content.description: To the right of warm up crack, step out over the void for v easy climbing on big holds. Stay out of the crack.
content.location: By the indeed problems right of crack.

content.description: Good example of the bad handhold / worse feet face climbing in the Wichitas.  Go up the face between the two thin pockets.  Crux is on the lip.
content.location: several feet to the left of "Intro"

content.description: Very easy 5.7ish three or four move problem using the crack.  Easy walk-off to the right.
content.location: As you get to the top of the ramp about 50 meters west of the road look to your right and you will see a boulder that is ~40 feet long and 10 feet high with a vertical face.  This problem is the obvious crack starting on the far right(east) of the boulder.  This face has four problems with a perfectly flat landing area.

content.description: Start matched on the slopey bulge at chest height. Make a right hand move up to a gaston crimp, high step onto the bulge, then press it out for the win.
content.location: Located just to the right of "Prelude to the Tas",  at the far right end of the Prelude boulder.

content.description: This is an awkward problem that has several variations.  Start on the far left side of the boulder and move left and then up and over the corner.
content.location: several feet to the left of "Two Holer."

content.description: Multiple variations on the face 8 feet left of the "Prelude".
Gently under-cling the fragile flake to a high step.  Much easier than it looks at first.
content.location: On the vertical south of the hallway to the east of Grinder.

content.description: Follow obvious highball crack.  Walk off to the east.  (If you want to practice clean aid climbing on tricky placements this is a good place to practice.)
content.location: This problem and "Hall Monitor" are in the hallway between to huge boulders 50 feet or so to the south of the "Prelude" boulder.  These problems are on the south side of the "hallway".

content.description: Pull onto the slab using the down-left facing crescent moon hold in the center of the wall. Get to a good stance, chalk up, and ooze your way up over the lip using non-existent holds. It will not be a graceful experience.
content.protection: Pads, a willingness to endure the cheese grater
content.location: If you're looking at the Prelude Boulder, turn right. Desperate Indeed lives just to the left of the obvious hand crack.

content.description: The contrived line left of the crack. It starts on nubbins for the paws, and the left foot has a crescent to stand on. Very very small crimps and a couple desperate moves and non existent feet get you up over the lip. Stay off the crack and face climb over for the hard grade.
content.location: To the right of desperate indeed. The blank looking face to the right of the 5.7 ish crack.

content.description: This area is often visited by tourists and I'm sure people have bouldered here over the years.  Although I have been surprised that most people I mention it to have never climbed here.  There are lots of boulders and I'm sure several problems can be added.  If you want a fun place to wander around and boulder and don't have much time this is a good spot.
